Docs.summary: Identifies the attached property.
Gets or sets a description of the status of an item within an element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property enables a client to ascertain whether an element is conveying status about an item. For example, an item associated with a contact in a messaging application might be "Busy" or "Connected". ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ItemStatusProperty
Public Shared ReadOnly ItemStatusProperty As DependencyProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the attached property.
Gets or sets a description of the type of the specified element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to obtain information about items in a list, tree view, or data grid. For example, an item in a file directory view might be a "Document File" or a "Folder". ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

Docs.summary: Identifies the attached property.
Gets or sets the ordinal location of this element within a set of elements that are considered to be siblings.

remarks.format: The `PositionInSet` attached property works in coordination with the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.SizeOfSet> dependency property to describe the ordinal position of this element in the set.
